channel.title:
Announcements

on Princeton COS Undergraduate Course Assistants Program
channel.description:
Recent content in Announcements

on Princeton COS Undergraduate Course Assistants Program

item.title: Recruiting UCAs for Spring 2023
item.description: The TigerUHR campaign for Spring 2023 will open at the end of January 2023, when everyone’s term schedules is clearer. If you want to be kept in the loop, don’t hesitate to fill-in this notice of interest. This will let us know to reach out to you directly when applications for Spring 2023 open up. Please note that it is important to submit this notice of interest even if you have worked us, as we may not automatically contact previously hired UCAs (for no particular reason other that we don’t want to spam people).

item.title: COS Lab Recruiting for Fall 2021
item.description: Today we sent the following announcement to all COS undergraduate students, with broader diffusion of this message to follow: Hello, and I hope your summer is going well! The Department of Computer Science is hiring enrolled undergraduates (that’s you!) to assist in many of our COS courses as Undergraduate Course Assistants (UCAs). This is an opportunity to gain teaching experience, work with and get to know faculty, and contribute back to our undergraduate curriculum.

item.title: Launching the New Site
item.description: This is a website to document the valuable contribution that undergraduate students provide the teaching mission of Princeton University’s Deparment of Computer Science, and to provide information on this program. The goal of the website will be, among other things, to help provide information to both prospective applicants and current students about the different roles and jobs fulfilled by Undergraduate Course Assistants. The website is built using the Hugo static site generator, the Hugo Book theme, and is hosted on GitHub Pages.
